issue.title: [CF 851] [target] becomes Unknown in chat event.
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Have the target die, then release afterwards.
2. Cast resurrection on target.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
Have the text event say the target's name instead of Unknown.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.2.2

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

^1^T^SCLEUEvents^T ^SSPELL_CAST_START^B ^t^SType^Scleu ^SCLEUDur^N2 ^SName^SAncestral~`Spirit ^SSourceUnit^Splayer ^SEnabled^B ^SFakeHidden^B ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^SALIVE ^SLevel^N1 ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^SEvents^T ^N1^T ^SType^SAnnouncements ^SChannel^SSAY ^SText^S[Name]~`is~`resurrecting~`[CastTarget(unit="player")]. ^SEvent^SOnStart ^t^Sn^N1 ^t^t^N62230^S~`~| ^Sicon^^


> Posted by CurseForge user felrece | Imported from CurseForge issue #851 | Raw

comments.body:
[CastTarget] is not a tag provided by TellMeWhen.

For this, you should be using an On Combat Event instead of an On Start event, and you should set the text to [Name(unit="target")] to print the name of your target. You can't get the target of the resurrection from the combat event because Blizzard has intentionally redacted that information for Spell Cast Start events to prevent potential abuse in PvP.

I'm also not sure what the purpose of that condition is - you can't possibly be resurrecting someone when you are dead.

Edited Aug 3, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thanks for the quick reply.

And with the conditions; it was a mistake. Was meant to be the target instead of player. I must've accidentally changed it thinking it was a different icon.


> Posted by CurseForge user felrece
